basics.name: Ariel Karas
basics.label: Junior S.R.E DevOps Engineer
basics.summary: Dedicated and highly motivated Junior DevOps Engineer with hands-on experience in building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation, and container orchestration. Seeking to leverage my skills to contribute to a forward-thinking organization that fosters innovation and growth.

education.institution: iNT college-institute of innovation & Technology Tel-Aviv, Israel

work.summary: Worked as an intern while completing the SRE DevOps Engineering course as a help desk-technician while delivering exceptional technical support to customers and maintaining the operation and performance of their equipment.
highlights: Explained technical information in clear terms to non-technical individuals to promote better understanding.
Installed, modified, and repaired software and hardware to resolve technical issues.
Configured hardware, devices, and software to set up workstations for employees.
Responded to support requests from end-users and patiently walked individuals through basic troubleshooting tasks.

work.summary: Responsible for commissioning and testing in an electrical communication cabinet on PV Plant.
highlights: Characterizing and planning communication cabinets for solar field sites.
Leading and managing communication teams on site.
Collaborating with Engineer teams overseas to establish communication cabinets and their technologies. Including Soltec, Meteorcontrol, Huawei, Kaco, and SolarEdge.

work.summary: Part of the R&D team, responsible for developing fast-paced project solutions for stacked projects.
highlights: Testing and maintaining different hardware components by performing diagnoses, investigations, and repairs of faults.
Keeping detailed documentation throughout all phases of development, testing, and analysis to improve organizational productivity.

work.summary: Served as an Assistant System Engineer and Team Leader at the R&D Robotics and Autonomy Department.
highlights: Contributing to the development and maintenance of systems that supported the integrity and operations of combat engineering units.
Installing, modifying, and repairing hardware and software to resolve technical issues.
Quickly resolving problems and escalating critical issues to knowledgeable support for quality resolution.
